docs.text: Pki-tools Index Auto-generated documentation index. A full list of Pki-tools project modules. PKI tools exposes a high level cryptography API for e.g.: Loading certificates from PEM strings/files/cryptography object into a pydantic model including all x509 v3 extensions Checking revocation of certificates using OCSP with CRL fallback Docs Documentation is available at: https://pki-tools.fulder.dev Quickstart Install pip install pki-tools Usage Loading certificate from pki_tools import Certificate cert_pem = """ -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- <CERT_PEM_BYTES> -----END CERTIFICATE----- """ cert = Certificate.from_pem_string(cert_pem) Loading chain from pki_tools import Chain issuer_cert_pem = """ -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- <ISSUER_CERT_PEM_BYTES> -----END CERTIFICATE----- """ chain = Chain.from_pem_string(issuer_cert_pem) Checking revocation using OCSP with CRL fallback The following example is using the cert and chain from the examples above from pki_tools import is_revoked if is_revoked(cert, chain): print("Certificate Revoked!") Examples Test Pki Tools Crl Exceptions Ocsp Types Certificate Certificates Chain Crl CryptoParser Csr Enums Extensions KeyPair Name Ocsp SignatureAlgorithm Utils Utils
docs.title: Pki-tools Index

docs.text: Auto-generated documentation index. A full list of Pki-tools project modules. docs.text: from pki_tools import Certificate cert_pem = """ -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- <CERT_PEM_BYTES> -----END CERTIFICATE----- """ cert = Certificate.from_pem_string(cert_pem)
docs.title: Loading certificate

docs.text: from pki_tools import Chain issuer_cert_pem = """ -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- <ISSUER_CERT_PEM_BYTES> -----END CERTIFICATE----- """ chain = Chain.from_pem_string(issuer_cert_pem)
docs.title: Loading chain

docs.text: The following example is using the cert and chain from the examples above from pki_tools import is_revoked if is_revoked(cert, chain): print("Certificate Revoked!") docs.text: Pki Tools Pki-tools Index / Pki Tools Auto-generated documentation for pki_tools module. Pki Tools is_revoked is_revoked_multiple_issuers Modules is_revoked Show source in init .py:31 Checks if a certificate is revoked using OCSP extension and/or CRL extension. By default, the OCSP is checked first with a fallback to CRL. If you only want to check OCSP or only CRL set the "revoke_mode" to either RevokeMode.OCSP_ONLY or RevokeMode.CRL_ONLY Arguments cert - The Certificates certificate to check revocation for. chain - The CA chain including one or more certificates and the issuer of the cert , signer of the OCSP response and CRL issuer. See types.Chain for examples how the chain can be created crl_cache_seconds - [CRL Only] Specifies how long the CRL should be cached, default is 1 hour. ocsp_res_cache_seconds - [OCSP Only] Specifies how long the OCSP response should be cached, default is 1 hour. revoke_mode - A types.RevokeMode specifying how to check for revocation, default is OCSP with CRL fallback Returns True if the certificate is revoked, False otherwise Raises exceptions.SignatureVerificationFailed -- When the Chain contains more than one certificate and the trust fails either because of some certificate has expired or some signature in the chain is invalid exceptions.RevokeCheckFailed -- When both OCSP and CRL checks fail Signature def is_revoked( cert: Certificate, chain: Chain, crl_cache_seconds: int = 3600, ocsp_res_cache_seconds: int = 3600, revoke_mode: RevokeMode = RevokeMode.OCSP_FALLBACK_CRL, ) -> bool: ... is_revoked_multiple_issuers Show source in init .py:85 Checks if a certificate is revoked first using the OCSP extension and then the CRL extensions. Note that OCSP has precedence over CRL meaning that if OCSP check is successful this function will return the bool without checking CRL. Otherwise, if OCSP check fails, CRL will be tried next. Arguments cert - The Certificates certificate to check revocation for. cert_issuer - The CA chain including one or more certificates and the issuer of the cert . See types.Chain for examples how the chain can be created ocsp_issuer - The CA chain including one or more certificates used for signing of the OCSP response crl_issuer - The CA chain including one or more certificates used for signing the CRL crl_cache_seconds - [CRL Only] Specifies how long the CRL should be cached, default is 1 hour. ocsp_res_cache_seconds - [OCSP Only] Specifies how long the OCSP response should be cached, default is 1 hour. revoke_mode - A types.RevokeMode specifying how to check for revocation, default is OCSP with CRL fallback Returns True if the certificate is revoked, False otherwise Raises exceptions.SignatureVerificationFailed -- When the Chain contains more than one certificate and the trust fails either because of some certificate has expired or some signature in the chain is invalid exceptions.RevokeCheckFailed -- When OCSP and/or CRL checks fail(s) Signature def is_revoked_multiple_issuers( cert: Certificate, cert_issuer: Chain, ocsp_issuer: Chain, crl_issuer: Chain, crl_cache_seconds: int = 3600, ocsp_res_cache_seconds: int = 3600, revoke_mode: RevokeMode = RevokeMode.OCSP_FALLBACK_CRL, ): ... Modules Crl Exceptions Ocsp Types Utils

docs.text: Show source in init .py:85 Checks if a certificate is revoked first using the OCSP extension and then the CRL extensions. Note that OCSP has precedence over CRL meaning that if OCSP check is successful this function will return the bool without checking CRL. Otherwise, if OCSP check fails, CRL will be tried next.
